pullRequest.body:
We construct the natural map `AdicCompletion I R âŠ—[R] M â†’â‚—[AdicCompletion I R] AdicCompletion I M` for any
`R`-module `M` and ideal `I` and show that it is an isomorphism for `M = R^n` and surjective if `M` is a finite `R`-module.

Co-authored-by: Judith Ludwig <ludwig@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #14534

For context: In the next PR we conclude from this one that this above map is an isomorphism for `R` Noetherian and `M` finite and deduce from this that `AdicCompletion I R` is a flat `R`-algebra if `R` is Noetherian.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e87de9ea0e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14358/commits/e87de9ea0e2728687197035ecaf0b8b3fa723a5f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Pi`|752|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.AsTensorProduct`|1170|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Pi.single_apply_smul`
`+ ofTensorProduct`
`+ ofTensorProductBil`
`+ ofTensorProductEquivOfPiFintype`
`+ ofTensorProduct_bijective_of_pi_of_fintype`
`+ ofTensorProduct_naturality`
`+ ofTensorProduct_surjective_of_fg`
`+ ofTensorProduct_tmul`
`+ piScalarRight`
`+ piScalarRightHom`
`+ piScalarRightHom_tmul`
`+ piScalarRightInv`
`+ piScalarRight_apply`
`+ piScalarRight_symm_single`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

I have the impression the file `AsTensorProduct` is quite slow.

!bench
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5f4b267e-9678-4a5a-962b-48ce7e897ba0) for commit 27167c35556a095291886e5da556d0a81726ae3a.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4dfa7641-7acd-4315-867e-895b72ce64ff/to/5f4b267e-9678-4a5a-962b-48ce7e897ba0) against commit aa30cf905a806cf29fc28dc8192b561b58913831.

Benchmark seems to be okay, but I agree the file is slow (and the last PR in this series will make it slower still). I think it's the module instance of  `AdicCompletion I M` over `AdicCompletion I R` that is slow, this was already visible in the algebra file and I think it's because of the many quotient rings involved. Do you think it is okay for now @riccardobrasca?
(In the future, might it help to introduce `IsAdicCompletion I M` which eliminates the explicit quotient construction?)

> Benchmark seems to be okay, but I agree the file is slow (and the last PR in this series will make it slower still). I think it's the module instance of `AdicCompletion I M` over `AdicCompletion I R` that is slow, this was already visible in the algebra file and I think it's because of the many quotient rings involved. Do you think it is okay for now @riccardobrasca? (In the future, might it help to introduce `IsAdicCompletion I M` which eliminates the explicit quotient construction?)

Can you open a discussion on Zulip about the slowness? We surely want `IsAdicCompletion`, but also `AdicCompletion` (to complete a given ring), and maybe it is worth to start investigating now.

> > Benchmark seems to be okay, but I agree the file is slow (and the last PR in this series will make it slower still). I think it's the module instance of `AdicCompletion I M` over `AdicCompletion I R` that is slow, this was already visible in the algebra file and I think it's because of the many quotient rings involved. Do you think it is okay for now @riccardobrasca? (In the future, might it help to introduce `IsAdicCompletion I M` which eliminates the explicit quotient construction?)
> 
> Can you open a discussion on Zulip about the slowness? We surely want `IsAdicCompletion`, but also `AdicCompletion` (to complete a given ring), and maybe it is worth to start investigating now.

Okay, I will do that after the weekend, since I will be away from a computer until Monday.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1c33359c-e180-431c-8b34-6144ef9e2dc0) for commit b134ed19aefe23e70c97e512b219dabce25824d7.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4dfa7641-7acd-4315-867e-895b72ce64ff/to/1c33359c-e180-431c-8b34-6144ef9e2dc0) against commit aa30cf905a806cf29fc28dc8192b561b58913831:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Algebra         instructions    14.0%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Basic           instructions    29.6%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Functoriality   instructions   -61.6%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/04e26275-26be-4d08-8dd1-ffeb4e23bd0e) for commit 00f96b96084f0a3e14793105fdda6a08a378c266.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2983abee-d37f-4773-ace1-4f30c7ff1087/to/04e26275-26be-4d08-8dd1-ffeb4e23bd0e) against commit 86414a80146a3735f0ce18dfcfa3dc88e6b3baf8:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Algebra         instructions    20.8%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Basic           instructions    47.7%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Functoriality   instructions   -60.2%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/c1f49737-93f6-43da-b030-bc33c5cc3820) for commit 55cf90705c3509ab5da127b7ecd4db0e147af667.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2983abee-d37f-4773-ace1-4f30c7ff1087/to/c1f49737-93f6-43da-b030-bc33c5cc3820) against commit 86414a80146a3735f0ce18dfcfa3dc88e6b3baf8:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Algebra         instructions    19.1%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Basic           instructions    34.2%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Functoriality   instructions   -61.7%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a50cfe65-06b9-429a-b2ed-ef196015bb23) for commit abf5c5635c9bde7cefa76b2c18405067b604e089.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2983abee-d37f-4773-ace1-4f30c7ff1087/to/a50cfe65-06b9-429a-b2ed-ef196015bb23) against commit 86414a80146a3735f0ce18dfcfa3dc88e6b3baf8:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Algebra         instructions    30.9%
- ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Basic           instructions    36.4%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Functoriality   instructions   -61.7%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/74e2d180-1ac7-47c1-9b6e-c7589ce1cd90) for commit d63433d6fe88638f26d368697c9c7e08814d0795.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2983abee-d37f-4773-ace1-4f30c7ff1087/to/74e2d180-1ac7-47c1-9b6e-c7589ce1cd90) against commit 86414a80146a3735f0ce18dfcfa3dc88e6b3baf8:

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14534~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

@riccardobrasca: The speed-up PR #14534 has been merged now (quick summary: currently no big speed-up, but when #11521 lands, this will also make the `AsTensorProduct` file fast). Anything else I should address for this PR?

Thanks for having investigated this!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9905668553/job/27365674678)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9905668553/job/27365674379)
Thanks for the review!
Can you mention somewhere also the file `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.TensorProduct.Prod`? (And maybe also the other way, mentioning this file there).
Does something (at least the defs) work over semirings?

```suggestion
variable (N : Type*) [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N] [Module S N] [IsScalarTower R S N]
```
Unless you move to semirings. Of course mathematically it is the same, but I think is more reasonable this way.
You can use `namespace TensorProduct` since a lot of declarations start like that.
Can you add the relevant `apply` and `symm_apply` lemmas?
I added an `apply` lemma and a `symm_single` lemma as I think that is the most reasonable one I could think of (as the inverse is private).

```suggestion
`(AdicCompletion I R) âŠ—[R] M â†’â‚—[AdicCompletion I R] AdicCompletion I M`.
```
Just to make it more readable here.

```suggestion
```
You can add `-smul_eq_mul, -Algebra.id.smul_eq_mul` in the `simpa` that break below to obtain the same result.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/AdicCompletion): comparison with tensor product
